summary: An archipelago is a group of islands, like a chain or cluster. It can be a sea with many scattered islands. The Indonesian Archipelago is the biggest in the world. The term comes from the Aegean Sea's many islands. Examples include the Hawaiian Islands, the Gal√°pagos, and the Philippines. Archipelagos can also be defined by political borders, like the San Juan Islands and Gulf Islands.
title: Archipelago
